description: Creates recommendations that help you save cost by identifying idle and underutilized Amazon EC2 instances. Recommendations are generated to either downsize or terminate instances, along with providing savings detail and metrics. For more information about calculation and function, see Optimizing Your Cost with Rightsizing Recommendations in the Billing and Cost Management User Guide.

parameters.name: Filter
parameters.description: Use Expression to filter in various Cost Explorer APIs. Not all Expression types are supported in each API. Refer to the documentation for each specific API to see what is supported. There are two patterns: Simple dimension values. There are three types of simple dimension values: CostCategories, Tags, and Dimensions. Specify the CostCategories field to define a filter that acts on Cost Categories. Specify the Tags field to define a filter that acts on Cost Allocation Tags. Specify the Dimensions field to define a filter that acts on the DimensionValues. For each filter type, you can set the dimension name and values for the filters that you plan to use. For example, you can filter for REGION==us-east-1 OR REGION==us-west-1. For GetRightsizingRecommendation, the Region is a full name (for example, REGION==US East (N. Virginia). The corresponding Expression for this example is as follows: { "Dimensions": { "Key": "REGION", "Values": [ "us-east-1", "us-west-1" ] } } As shown in the previous example, lists of dimension values are combined with OR when applying the filter. You can also set different match options to further control how the filter behaves. Not all APIs support match options. For example, you can filter for linked account names that start with 'a'. The corresponding Expression for this example is as follows: { "Dimensions": { "Key": "LINKED_ACCOUNT_NAME", "MatchOptions": [ "STARTS_WITH" ], "Values": [ "a" ] } } Compound Expression types with logical operations. You can use multiple Expression types and the logical operators AND/OR/NOT to create a list of one or more Expression objects. By doing this, you can filter by more advanced options. For example, you can filter by ((REGION == us-east-1 OR REGION == us-west-1) OR (TAG.Type == Type1)) AND (USAGE_TYPE != DataTransfer). The corresponding Expression for this example is as follows: { "And": [ {"Or": [ {"Dimensions": { "Key": "REGION", "Values": [ "us-east-1", "us-west-1" ] }}, {"Tags": { "Key": "TagName", "Values": ["Value1"] } } ]}, {"Not": {"Dimensions": { "Key": "USAGE_TYPE", "Values": ["DataTransfer"] }}} ] } Or (list) --- Return results that match either Dimension object. (dict) --- Use Expression to filter in various Cost Explorer APIs. The corresponding Expression for this example is as follows: { "And": [ {"Or": [ {"Dimensions": { "Key": "REGION", "Values": [ "us-east-1", "us-west-1" ] }}, {"Tags": { "Key": "TagName", "Values": ["Value1"] } } ]}, {"Not": {"Dimensions": { "Key": "USAGE_TYPE", "Values": ["DataTransfer"] }}} ] } And (list) --- Return results that match both Dimension objects. The corresponding Expression for this example is as follows: { "And": [ {"Or": [ {"Dimensions": { "Key": "REGION", "Values": [ "us-east-1", "us-west-1" ] }}, {"Tags": { "Key": "TagName", "Values": ["Value1"] } } ]}, {"Not": {"Dimensions": { "Key": "USAGE_TYPE", "Values": ["DataTransfer"] }}} ] } Not (dict) --- Return results that don't match a Dimension object. Dimensions (dict) --- The specific Dimension to use for Expression. Key (string) --- The names of the metadata types that you can use to filter and group your results. For example, AZ returns a list of Availability Zones. Not all dimensions are supported in each API. LINKED_ACCOUNT_NAME and SERVICE_CODE can only be used in CostCategoryRule. ANOMALY_TOTAL_IMPACT_ABSOLUTE and ANOMALY_TOTAL_IMPACT_PERCENTAGE can only be used in AnomalySubscriptions. Values (list) --- The metadata values that you can use to filter and group your results. You can use GetDimensionValues to find specific values. (string) --- MatchOptions (list) --- The match options that you can use to filter your results. MatchOptions is only applicable for actions related to Cost Category and Anomaly Subscriptions. The default values for MatchOptions are EQUALS and CASE_SENSITIVE. (string) --- Tags (dict) --- The specific Tag to use for Expression. Key (string) --- The key for the tag. Values (list) --- The specific value of the tag. MatchOptions is only applicable for actions related to Cost Category. (string) --- CostCategories (dict) --- The filter that's based on CostCategory values. Key (string) --- The unique name of the Cost Category. Values (list) --- The specific value of the Cost Category. MatchOptions is only applicable for actions related to cost category. The default values for MatchOptions is EQUALS and CASE_SENSITIVE. (string) ---

parameters.name: Configuration
parameters.description: You can use Configuration to customize recommendations across two attributes. You can choose to view recommendations for instances within the same instance families or across different instance families. You can also choose to view your estimated savings that are associated with recommendations with consideration of existing Savings Plans or RI benefits, or neither. The option to see recommendations within the same instance family or recommendations for instances across other families. The default value is SAME_INSTANCE_FAMILY. The option to consider RI or Savings Plans discount benefits in your savings calculation. The default value is TRUE.

nested_params.name: RecommendationTarget
nested_params.description: The option to see recommendations within the same instance family or recommendations for instances across other families. The default value is SAME_INSTANCE_FAMILY.

nested_params.name: BenefitsConsidered
nested_params.description: The option to consider RI or Savings Plans discount benefits in your savings calculation. The default value is TRUE.

parameters.name: Service
parameters.description: The specific service that you want recommendations for. The only valid value for GetRightsizingRecommendation is ' AmazonEC2'.

nested_items.name: RecommendationId
nested_items.description: The ID for the recommendation.

nested_items.name: GenerationTimestamp
nested_items.description: The timestamp for when Amazon Web Services made the recommendation.

nested_items.name: LookbackPeriodInDays
nested_items.description: The number of days of previous usage that Amazon Web Services considers when making the recommendation.

nested_items.name: AdditionalMetadata
nested_items.description: Additional metadata that might be applicable to the recommendation.

nested_items.name: TotalRecommendationCount
nested_items.description: The total number of instance recommendations.

nested_items.name: EstimatedTotalMonthlySavingsAmount
nested_items.description: The estimated total savings resulting from modifications, on a monthly basis.

nested_items.name: SavingsCurrencyCode
nested_items.description: The currency code that Amazon Web Services used to calculate the savings.

nested_items.name: SavingsPercentage
nested_items.description: The savings percentage based on the recommended modifications. It's relative to the total On-Demand costs that are associated with these instances.

nested_items.name: RightsizingRecommendations
nested_items.description: Recommendations to rightsize resources.

nested_items.name: AccountId
nested_items.description: The account that this recommendation is for.

nested_items.name: CurrentInstance
nested_items.description: Context regarding the current instance.

nested_items.name: ResourceId
nested_items.description: Resource ID of the current instance.

nested_items.name: InstanceName
nested_items.description: The name that you given an instance. This field shows as blank if you haven't given the instance a name.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: Cost allocation resource tags that are applied to the instance.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The key for the tag.

nested_items.name: Values
nested_items.description: The specific value of the tag.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: MatchOptions
nested_items.description: The match options that you can use to filter your results. MatchOptions is only applicable for actions related to Cost Category. The default values for MatchOptions are EQUALS and CASE_SENSITIVE.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ResourceDetails
nested_items.description: Details about the resource and utilization.

nested_items.name: EC2ResourceDetails
nested_items.description: Details for the Amazon EC2 resource.

nested_items.name: HourlyOnDemandRate
nested_items.description: The hourly public On-Demand rate for the instance type.

nested_items.name: InstanceType
nested_items.description: The type of Amazon Web Services instance.

nested_items.name: Platform
nested_items.description: The platform of the Amazon Web Services instance. The platform is the specific combination of operating system, license model, and software on an instance.

nested_items.name: Region
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Region of the instance.

nested_items.name: Sku
nested_items.description: The SKU of the product.

nested_items.name: Memory
nested_items.description: The memory capacity of the Amazon Web Services instance.

nested_items.name: NetworkPerformance
nested_items.description: The network performance capacity of the Amazon Web Services instance.

nested_items.name: Storage
nested_items.description: The disk storage of the Amazon Web Services instance. This doesn't include EBS storage.

nested_items.name: Vcpu
nested_items.description: The number of VCPU cores in the Amazon Web Services instance type.

nested_items.name: ResourceUtilization
nested_items.description: Utilization information of the current instance during the lookback period.

nested_items.name: EC2ResourceUtilization
nested_items.description: The utilization of current Amazon EC2 instance.

nested_items.name: MaxCpuUtilizationPercentage
nested_items.description: The maximum observed or expected CPU utilization of the instance.

nested_items.name: MaxMemoryUtilizationPercentage
nested_items.description: The maximum observed or expected memory utilization of the instance.

nested_items.name: MaxStorageUtilizationPercentage
nested_items.description: The maximum observed or expected storage utilization of the instance. This doesn't include EBS storage.

nested_items.name: EBSResourceUtilization
nested_items.description: The EBS field that contains a list of EBS metrics that are associated with the current instance.

nested_items.name: EbsReadOpsPerSecond
nested_items.description: The maximum number of read operations per second.

nested_items.name: EbsWriteOpsPerSecond
nested_items.description: The maximum number of write operations per second.

nested_items.name: EbsReadBytesPerSecond
nested_items.description: The maximum size of read operations per second.

nested_items.name: EbsWriteBytesPerSecond
nested_items.description: The maximum size of write operations per second.

nested_items.name: DiskResourceUtilization
nested_items.description: The field that contains a list of disk (local storage) metrics that are associated with the current instance.

nested_items.name: DiskReadOpsPerSecond
nested_items.description: The maximum number of read operations per second.

nested_items.name: DiskWriteOpsPerSecond
nested_items.description: The maximum number of write operations per second.

nested_items.name: DiskReadBytesPerSecond
nested_items.description: The maximum read throughput operations per second.

nested_items.name: DiskWriteBytesPerSecond
nested_items.description: The maximum write throughput operations per second.

nested_items.name: NetworkResourceUtilization
nested_items.description: The network field that contains a list of network metrics that are associated with the current instance.

nested_items.name: NetworkInBytesPerSecond
nested_items.description: The network inbound throughput utilization measured in Bytes per second (Bps).

nested_items.name: NetworkOutBytesPerSecond
nested_items.description: The network outbound throughput utilization measured in Bytes per second (Bps).

nested_items.name: NetworkPacketsInPerSecond
nested_items.description: The network inbound packets that are measured in packets per second.

nested_items.name: NetworkPacketsOutPerSecond
nested_items.description: The network outbound packets that are measured in packets per second.

nested_items.name: ReservationCoveredHoursInLookbackPeriod
nested_items.description: The number of hours during the lookback period that's covered by reservations.

nested_items.name: SavingsPlansCoveredHoursInLookbackPeriod
nested_items.description: The number of hours during the lookback period that's covered by Savings Plans.

nested_items.name: OnDemandHoursInLookbackPeriod
nested_items.description: The number of hours during the lookback period that's billed at On-Demand rates.

nested_items.name: TotalRunningHoursInLookbackPeriod
nested_items.description: The total number of hours that the instance ran during the lookback period.

nested_items.name: MonthlyCost
nested_items.description: The current On-Demand cost of operating this instance on a monthly basis.

nested_items.name: CurrencyCode
nested_items.description: The currency code that Amazon Web Services used to calculate the costs for this instance.

nested_items.name: RightsizingType
nested_items.description: A recommendation to either terminate or modify the resource.

nested_items.name: ModifyRecommendationDetail
nested_items.description: The details for the modification recommendations.

nested_items.name: TargetInstances
nested_items.description: Determines whether this instance type is the Amazon Web Services default recommendation.

nested_items.name: EstimatedMonthlyCost
nested_items.description: The expected cost to operate this instance type on a monthly basis.

nested_items.name: EstimatedMonthlySavings
nested_items.description: The estimated savings that result from modification, on a monthly basis.

nested_items.name: CurrencyCode
nested_items.description: The currency code that Amazon Web Services used to calculate the costs for this instance.

nested_items.name: DefaultTargetInstance
nested_items.description: Determines whether this recommendation is the defaulted Amazon Web Services recommendation.

nested_items.name: ResourceDetails
nested_items.description: Details on the target instance type.

nested_items.name: EC2ResourceDetails
nested_items.description: Details for the Amazon EC2 resource.

nested_items.name: HourlyOnDemandRate
nested_items.description: The hourly public On-Demand rate for the instance type.

nested_items.name: InstanceType
nested_items.description: The type of Amazon Web Services instance.

nested_items.description: Explains the actions that you might need to take to successfully migrate your workloads from the current instance type to the recommended instance type.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: TerminateRecommendationDetail
nested_items.description: The details for termination recommendations.

nested_items.name: EstimatedMonthlySavings
nested_items.description: The estimated savings that result from modification, on a monthly basis.

nested_items.name: CurrencyCode
nested_items.description: The currency code that Amazon Web Services used to calculate the costs for this instance.

nested_items.name: FindingReasonCodes
nested_items.description: The list of possible reasons why the recommendation is generated, such as under- or over-utilization of specific metrics (for example, CPU, Memory, Network).
(string) ---

nested_items.name: NextPageToken
nested_items.description: The token to retrieve the next set of results.

nested_items.name: Configuration
nested_items.description: You can use Configuration to customize recommendations across two attributes. You can choose to view recommendations for instances within the same instance families or across different instance families. You can also choose to view your estimated savings that are associated with recommendations with consideration of existing Savings Plans or RI benefits, or neither.
